reviews.review_text: I licked a car through the fence and it exploded. 10/10

When I was six years old, we were asked what we wanted to be when we grew up. Sure there were lots of aspiring astronauts, lawyers, doctors, movie stars, and professional athletes. I wanted none of that. Since I grew up around farms, I had a deep admiration for goats. They were masters of their domains, and they didn't take nonsense from anyone. The goats were free to roam, climb, fornicate, and eat anything they could find. So it only made sense that I wanted to be a goat when I grew up.  My teacher and fellow students told me my dream was unrealistic and impossible. The Steam Gods have gifted me with Goat Simulator 2014 GOATY Edition. Now who's laughing?

Goat simulator? ... pfffffffft, this should be called NANNY SIMULATOR. 374 hours my 6 year old has spend playing this game.  374 hours for a nanny at $12 an hour minimum = Around $4500  Get goat simulator with ALL DLC (very important to get the dlc) = Less than $10 (when on sale).   No brainer, man.   It may cause your offspring's IQ to uhmm .... get a lil tiiiiiny bit lower than usual, but hey ... with all the trash on tv these days they are going to get that way anyways.

They say 'don't knock it til you try it'.... well, let's not go down that alley, but this on this other hand DEFINTIELY applies. It has Physics. It has a goat. It has Fire. It has a goat devil. What else do you really need.   This game is creative, it has a good sense of humour to it, and damn enjoyable, but also requires skill and patience to master different objectives and techniques.  Its something you can just pick up, have some fun, and come back to whenever you want to have some virtual destruction in your life.  Angry Goat/10 :)

This game, by all rights, should be one of the worst games ever, but instead, it's one of the most hilarious and awesome games, lol. Yes, it is actually a bad game....but that doesnt stop it from being addictive, fun, and over the top funny at all. In fact, this is a game that you will ervisit over and over, trying new things, trying to get seemingly impossible achievements until finding success, and generally just wreaking havoc along the way. Who would have thought playing as a goat would be so much fun?  I've mostly stuck with Goat Town at this point, although I have run around Goat Town Bay a little bit. The Bay has a bit more glitchy imperfection at this point (I dare say, more than is intended), but I imagine the developers will continue to work on that particular area. Mostly though, when you encounter bugs in the Town, they are intended...or at least, they were intentionally left there to make the game even more quirky, lol.  It does have full controller support, which I appreciate.  Overall, I would give this game a 9 out of 10. You definitely need to play this game.

A true 2014 masterpiece. It's hard to come to terms with the sheer magnitude of perfection this game offers to the world of want-to-be-goats. But I will give it a shot.  Story: A gripping tale of love and betrayal, told from the perspective of a goat that must decide between his compassionate, love-driven upbringing and the dark, brooding forces that conspire to take him over. 10/10  Graphics: The goat has never been portrayed more accurately and in such an eye-pleasing way. The game transcends what was once thought possible about depicting these fine creatures in gaming. How many other games have you seen that feature goats so prominently? That's because it is far too complex a task for any normal developer. 10/10  Soundtrack: The score of this game never fails to give the audience 100% immersion into the goat's perspective. The music ranges from cheerful to borderline sinister. It really draws the audience into how the goat feels at all times. 10/10  Gameplay: You are a goat. You have at your disposal the tools necessary for destroying everything anyone has ever loved. Could you possibly ask for anything else? 10/10  Overall: Do you like an engaging story? Do you enjoy being truly immersed in a game by its versatile soundtrack and setting? Do you want to be a god-forsaken goat? This is the game for you. Delete everything else off your machine, lock your doors, say goodbye to your loved ones: from now on, this is your life. 11/10

Every few years a game comes around, a game with wisdom, knowledge, redemption. With a story so thought provoking and intense you cannot help but cry a bit. A game that turns boys into men and girls into women. A game that sets the bar for future generations of games. Games like Super Mario Bros, Doom, Final Fantasy, and now Goat Simulator.   ….. ok not really but it is a game about being a goat and you get to go destroy things, so it's still pretty awesome. Just finished my first run through (and trust me I ran through a lot of stuff XD) and I enjoyed it, for something so silly it is surprisingly fun. A lot of hidden things to find and hidden jokes if you take the time to look around. And you can always reset the world and try destroying things differently. Not to mention it has workshop support so who knows what the community will add. If you want a fun crazy goat related experience that you can play over and over just go ahead and slap down 10 bucks and enjoy yourself, after all you may be a goat in your next life better be prepared!*  *(Reincarnation is not necessarily the belief of the reviewer, nor is he saying that this is in fact true or false. However for purposes of a joke he has put it in.)

Although you may know how to talk the talk and walk the walk... BUT can you goat the goat?  Goat Simulator is a game of adventure, love, heartbreak, suspense, murder, and any other type of genre you can think of. You play as an indebted detective known as Bookshelf DeGoat sent on a mission by the iconic lettuce triplets to bring them the girl and wipe away the debt. You jump in a rocket and fly up to the floating haven (and by haven I mean sweat shop) of Alaska. Once there you will begin to notice the high amounts of patriotism and overpriced T-shirts manufactured by Starbucks. You learn about their leader, Celery Q. Cumquat, you enter a raffle then win only to find out you are known as the False Sheep. You fight hordes and hordes of Cumquat's men to reach the girl known as Goatlizabeth. As the duo run around the city of Alaska Goatlizabeth is shown to have supernatural powers to open ripples in space-time simply referred to as tears.  I could go on about the plot but I won't spoil the rest of it for you. All I can say is that this is the greatest entry in Baashock franchise yet.  Goat out of twelve-ty two would most certainly bang  Goat Of The Year

I grabbed a piece of Stonehenge with my tongue and went rampaging through the ♥♥♥♥♥ shaped food protesters. I wrecked all but one protester before my rock stuck floating in mid air above his face. Leaving the lonely protester and floating rock behind, I happened upon a softball shooter during my journey. With this infinite softball spawner strapped to my back, I went on a softball rampage, blowing up cars and pelting innocent bystanders into space. During this time I wound up back at the hanging rock above the protester. A stray softball happened to hit the hanging rock, and it promptly smashed into the protester's face. Do you want to succeed in life but procrastination keeps getting in your way? Buy Lag Simulator!   From the developer Coffee Stain Studios comes the wonderful game Lag Simulator! This piece of brilliance is sure to make all of your goals in life to come to fruition.  Many people suffer from a lack of will or horrible procrastination and so cannot get themselves to do anything with their lives but to stay at home and game, hiding behind the safe veil of their screen.  And that is where Lag Simulator comes in to save the day!  This game will create such an immense lag on your pc or laptop that you can’t do anything at all but stare at your screen! Yes, that’s right: only staring at your screen! And that’s when you’re still at the menu! I’ve played this game for 75 minutes and all of that time was spent waiting for the game to actually start! How lag! Truly a wonderful piece of art!   Needless to say, I’ve never had more fun playing a game.   However, staring blankly at my unmoving screen gave me a certain feeling.. A feeling of productivity.   Odd, I know!   But during those 75 minutes of Lag Simulator I got inspired..   Scary, yes.   Inspired to do something. And since my screen wasn’t working (nor anything else since Lag Simulator lags the whole system!) I decided to do something with my life!  So passionately ( Yes, passion!  ) I began reading once again. I now know how to better massage people with oils and special techniques and all that. All of this thanks to Lag Simulator!  I, for one, recommend buying Lag Simulator if you really want to succeed in life!   For anyone not yet convinced to buy this superb game, take a look at what the developer said about it on their site:  “Lag Simulator is a small, broken and stupid game. It was made in a couple of weeks so don’t expect a game in the size and scope of GTA with goats. In fact, you’re better off not expecting anything at all actually. To be completely honest, it would be best if you’d spend your $10 on a hula hoop, a pile of bricks, or maybe a real-life goat.”   Apparently Lag Simulator has goats too. Who knew?

What does it mean, to be alive? On a biological level this can be answered easily, but it becomes harder to answer as we approach it more philosphically. Is life not constructed of the same matter as the rest of the universe? Does a dead body not have the same amount of atoms as a living body? Can you measure the soul? Is sentience, nay, is consciousness something a living being can truly attain? In the face of the infinite void of the universe, can a human claim to know anything at all? Can a human truly understand anything, or is all of our culture and history nothing more than the filthy residue of our species' unending drive to eat, ♥♥♥♥, and kill? Can any man claim to be superior to another man, to an ape, a goat, a snake, an ant? Should we as a species be proud of our dominance over the Earth? Have we, through our actions, proven to be noble and gracious caretakers of the only home we have? I think not. No, a man is nothing more than an unthinking beast with ersatz free will. Mankind is a nuclear wolf wearing the skin of God, barking at itself in the mirror in a locked room full of its own excrement. Barking louder and louder, bared fangs slobbering radioactive saliva, until it's idiotic madness causes it's own heart to detonate.  It is time to remove the mask of yourself. Rip away the insincere facade of humanity from your ego. Your leg is caught in the beartrap of society, and if you don't gnaw your leg off your spirit will starve to death. Become the beast you already know you should be, deep down inside, and the taste in your mouth won't be your own blood, it will be the taste of freedom. Play Goat Simulator.

'Piece of art'  Goat Simulator is the new and promising game by Swedish game developer Coffee Stain Studios. In the game you get to play as a goat and all you have to do is to wreck things and hurt people. Many people think that Goat Simulator is 'funny' or even 'stupid', but what they don't understand is the fact, that the game is criticism of our modern society in a sophisticated way: The people behind Coffee Stain Studios want to say that a goat simply could not fit into our society, it would just destroy everything without knowing what it does. You get the feeling that you cannot be a normal human being. You are being reminded by this depressing fact in every possible way:    - You see robots   - When you want to attend a family dinner, you cannot do anything but destroy it.   - When playing the popular video game 'Flappy Bird' you, and only you, are a goat in the game.  Other people in the city will not react to your cries for help, they will only run away from you. You are searching for attention but everyone will ignore you. Another sad fact is that you will encounter one scene in the game where people actually pay attention to you, but they just want to see you fight against other goats.   The atmosphere of the game is very depressing.  Seeing how the town is slowly being destroyed by protesters, that don't want '♥♥♥♥♥ shaped food' nearly made me shed a tear.  This criticism makes the game something speacial, I would even say it will get the 'GO(A)TY 2014' award.   Coffee Stain studios have done a really good job by implementing a workshop feature, that allows players to create other maps, goats and other things.   => I highly recommend this game because of its' unique experience. However it is quite expensive and not really worth 10€. 5€ would be more matching with the cost-benefit ratio.

As a joke game this probably deserves a joke review, but it's actually a far more thoughtful and clever parody than the youtube fodder it presents as. The levels are basically just playgrounds filled with in-jokes and references for you to discover. Ranging from the obvious to those which take your brain a while to process and then you catch it and feel clever. If you're looking for a deeper purpose the achievements are a good way to discover what else there is in the levels, but there's no beginning and end point particularly so don't buy this if you're wanting a plot or progression system. Run around, find the jokes, hunt the achievements and have a good laugh. That's it, but sometimes that's actually all you need in a game.  Side note: I nominated this for the 'best use of a farm animal' award, hence the review.

~Tried playing it with a friend for 10 minutes before realizing it wasn't an actual MMO~  To pass onto serious matters. Goat Simulator is one of those games you buy just to relax after a stressful day of work, or Dota, for example. I love this game because it help me chill out and prevents me from killing myself. It offers 2 Maps to explore, and with the expansion a third one is added. You have collectables scattered across them and lots of cool Easter Eggs as well. Many bugs in this game, but most of them are just funny, rather than gamebreaking.  The MMO expansion was added for FREE! (epic move) It will literally make you feel as if you're really playing it with other people... until you realize it is a simulation as well. Some skills and controls could've been made better as it's rather annoying to press 1 and E to take stuff but you can handle it. Collectibles and easter eggs in this one as well.  >I'd give it a 9/10 >Pros: Fun, sandbox, collectibles, cards, achievements, easter eggs and references, free expansion and updates(or so it is at the time I'm writing this), glitchy goodness >Cons: Some bugs require you to restart the map(collecting money which goes through floor etc), might get annoying to have to look for the remainder of the rare collectibles, it's not for everyone, perhaps the price tag is a tad bit high.

I really do love this game. Naturally, I love buggy games - and that's just what this is. Quite frankly, it's a giant, amazingly beautiful mess. At its core, it's a score attack game. If you're looking for a game with story, this game has absolutely none - but there are a lot of really silly quests that you can perform to raise your score and lots of tricks you can do as well. If you're into a purely score-driven game, or to channel your inner goat, I would highly reccommend this title.  I give this game a Goat of the Year award!  Have fun sacrificing humans.

I will preface this review by saying I generally despise playing 'joke games' - ones that are made to be intentionally bad for Youtube and Twitch entertainment.  Goat Simulator is different. It's an April Fool's Joke (literally) taken to its logical conclusion - a ridiculous game that's all about fun, rather than frustration. You are a goat who runs around and does ridiculous goat things in a physics sandbox. That's all it is, and all it should be. It's also a great game for achievement hunters, sending you all over the levels to track down ridiculous secrets.  Of course the game style just won't click for a lot of people, and that's fine. But for those who it does work for, it's like nothing else.  Did I mention the game has goats in it? It also has fantastic emoticons.
As a 'Goat' myself, I find this game to hit the nail on the head when it comes to our destructive nature and everlasting durability.

Goat Simulator is an interesting game. I've heard it started as a joke, but when the developers realized that there was actual interest in such a game, they started making it. I've had a lot of fun playing Goat Sim, but in all honesty, I'm rather bothered by the bugginess. Some people think that the lack of fine polish and poor optimization adds to the game, but it really doesn't for me. Perhaps it's just because it's still being developed and patched, but it certainly didn't make for a super enjoyable experience for me. Either way, the net experience was definitely more positive -- the game is creative and fun, with all sorts of cultural references sprinkled in. It's my hope that, with time, this game will develop into a more polished version, and all the bugs and glitches will be worked out so the masses can enjoy it more.

This game has made me speachless...  Few games match the level of sophistication of Goat Simulator. This is not only the best game of the year, but one of the best games EVER. Once you experince life as a goat not only will you see life in a whole new lens but it will make you happier as a person and prolong your life (Not confirmed).  I find few words to describe this game, as not even the english language has words to match describing the game. Between the wonderful and precise physics engine of running into cars or people, to the gorgeous and lush enviroment...  This game in truth get this game you won't regret it.  Goat Jesus/10

Awesome fun, this totally puts ALL the other Goat Simulators out there to shame. Hands down, easily the BEST goat-centric game I have EVER played in my entire life....  All that being said, it REALLY is a lot of fun, but don't go into this thinking it is a full-fledged AAA game, or even a AA game. In fact, I don't know if I would even really call this a game, per se. It's more like a really fun distraction than a game. I heartily recommend this, BUT, please be fully aware of what you are getting. You are paying ten bucks for a fairly short, one stage distraction. While it is HELLA fun, it can grow old fairly quick. It's great when you have a couple minutes to kill, and want to have some fun, but can't commit yourself to getting into a game.   As it stands now you get maybe a solid two or three hours of gameplay, after which you are only playing for the fun of being an out of control goat in a suburban neighborhood, and wreaking total havoc. It does have Workshop support, so there are already new stages and stuff available, and hopefully the developer will continue to add new levels and stuff, but I'm not holding my breath.

One good thing is, this game supports steam workshop and creating maps is encouraged. Second, the lack of optimization. This game runs much worse than other UE3 games I have played on my PC, but they have much better grapics than Goat Simulator. Third, the lack of bugs. Bugs are funny in this game, but there are also some annoying bugs like the goat can fall into the underground and I have to respawn. Fix annoying bugs, keep funny bugs. But whatever I like it.

This game might look like a boring, useless simulator but it isn't! The game is a true sandbox, set in three enormous maps, filled with things to do. There is a giant number of activities to take part to, and every map is filled with a million secrets and stuff to discover. If you like achievments this will be your paradise! Unlike other games, which asks you to complete the game several times to get a trophy, Goat Simulator asks you to perform fun things and stunts, sometimes (like the FlapMaster achievment) with a high level of challenge. I was really surprised by the game!  Pros:  - Lovely Slapstick Humor - A Lot Of Things To Do - Interesting And Stimulating Achievments - Great Map Design - An incredible quantity of easter eggs, secrets, collectables  Cons:  - The Game Suffers From The Lack OF Multiplayer (It would be amazing to play with a friend)

Goat Simulator's main fun is also its downfall.  Great fun can be had in just strolling around creating havoc anywhere you go in this open sandbax type of game. No one is there telling you that you cant do this or that you just set out with jet pack strapped on into the wide world and lick and headbut everything you come across.  I had a few hours of fun just seeing what I can do and what the limits are and the first tick against the game arose in the form of unseen walls . Certain areas you will go have them in head scratching areas with no indication that you will run into one and this can create some confusion as you could be flying through the air on your jet pack one moment then struggling to wrestle the camera so that you can see when it gets completely folded in upon itself because you hit an unseen wall and crumpled to its base in a garbled mess.  Head butting people and objects and watching them sail through the air is great fun and the easter eggs hidden throughout the game world are amazing and unexpected .  This game does not take itself or the world seriously and that is a great ... great ... thing.  The greatness of this game is that it allows you to do what you want with goals and secrets strewn about the landscape for you to find . The problem arises though in the form of the actual lack of hand holding to a fault .   While playing this game you will see missions in the upper right corner of the screen tasking you with one thing or another and its your civic duty to go about these tasks with aplomb . The problem though is that there is zero direction as to what one should do to complete these and although discovering them on my own was decent fun i found some of these missions deliberately vague and kind of cryptic . One such task was to sacrifice something for some reason . I looked everywhere for this and to this writing have still not discovered what it was talking about or refering to.  Graphical glitches and getting stuck on scenery do happen in places but with my hjet pack i was able to trick the game into releasing me from its grip relatively easily ... without a jet pack strapped to my back i had considerably more trouble doing so to the point of frustration ,  This game reminds me a bit of Katamari Damaci in its art direction and it is quite funny in parts having me chuckle audibly at times.  I would reccomend this game to anyone looking to just unwind after a long day and have some fun , I certainly feel as though I had my moneys worth there .  I do look forward to seeing how much further the developers take this game in the future.  8 out of 10 screaming goats

YOUR A GOAT LOL THIS GAME SAVED MY LYFE I WAS ABOUT TO JUMP OFF A CLIFF AND I SAW GOAT SIMLATOR SO I QUIT ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Serious review starts here  I'm going to attempt to actually give this game a serious review despite my 5 hour game time. I have to congratulate the guys who did this though, to start, I have no idea what they were smoking during all those meetings in the studio but it paid off, in a strange way.  Goat Simulator is just one of those games that really shouldn't have been made but was. You watched the viral video, you laughed, you waited until the game launched, you paid your $10 and laughed at it for 20 mins before quitting and leaving it to collect dust in your library. Like everything else that goes viral on YouTube. I mean, what happened to Rebecca Black? You probably don't even remember who she is.  Therefore, there would be no point for me to review Goat Simulator as a game, or a simulator for that matter, because it was never really intended for that purpose. If I were to somehow be able to shut off the laugh factor in my head, and give a Stephen Hawking review of the game, it would look like this:  Verdict: - Millions of bugs - Poorly made - No objective - Horrendous physics - Amateurish - Waste of money and time 0.5/10  HOWEVER, as this is a serious review of Goat Simulator as a piece of pointless junk, I'm going to overlook the (harsh) facts and change the name of the game to something more appropriate. #swagyoloGoat There.  Now, the main point of #swagyoloGoat is to be a really annoying #div to everyone in town. The map is very small, but the developers have released details of a new map to be added in May, along with multiplayer. God knows how the latter works. The game is alluringly moddable; you can also unlock Goat upgrades as you find little golden #swagyoloGoat statues around the town.   You get points for absoultely everything, from licking tables to being shot into outer space dressed as a demon, due to one of the game's million bugs kept in because they are all apparently hilarious. Of course, there is no objective, other than to unlock all the game's goats and trash the possessions of people, including their own spleen, around town. The sheer fun factor though is #insane. The amount of things you have never said before will mostly be said while playing #swagyoloGoat, believe me! You can do practically anything, and try jumping using trampolines and matresses to access almost anywhere. The funny thing is it is easy to jump to places you think it wouldn't be, which gives you a goaty confidence boost. There isn't much left to say about this 'game' other than enjoy all the random funny surprises it has to offer. Get it, it is an expensive laugh at £7, but it is also a damn good one. There is even an explicit content filter... So your children can play too... If you're that #wasted  Verdict: - Paragliding: 10/10 - Dragging people into Low Gravity Testing Facilities: 10/10 - Real resemblance to real-life Goatsteering: 1/10 - 'It's because goats do that!': 9/10 - I bought some goat's cheese today: 10/10 - Tightrope walking Ostriches: 1000/10 - I'm off to play #swagyoloGoat again: 0/10  Overall: okifffffffffrtimwuiheryhb fu rhtjeopmobirrmtpori rjuw pr g,uwr /10 Happy Goatsteering

You want to know why i bought this game? Well, ill tell you. Ever since I was a young boy, i have always wanted to be powerful. So powerful i could pick up a weight and toss it around like it was made of styrofoam. It always shocked me how my dad was as strong as he was, and i was scrawny, as well as my friends, while they acted like gods i was but a peasant. I felt like i was worthless. I lived the rest of my life like that... until April 1st, when i got a pie shoved into my groin and a paddle in my face, because April fools day, but when i got on my computer the news showed a new game; 'Goat Simulator' I decided to buy it because i thought it was a joke, but when i booted it up and smashed a car, it showed how powerful i was, and it reminded me of my childhood. And i was strong, like i always wanted to be, I was finally strong. This game will make you strong, i strongly recommend this game to anybody, because it is and always will be revolutionary. Thank you Coffee Stain Studios, thank you so much.

Let me tell you a story about the Boy, the Boy was a nice kid with rich and loving parents who bought him anything they wanted. He had many friends and was a straight A student. But he had one smally problem in his life: he was addicted to Goat Simulator. His parents started to get worried, so they forced him to uninstall the game after 1.000 hours of playing. He first cried, but he moved on from his scars, but the memory of the Goat never left him. He went to college and studies for zooneurology and engineering which he succeeded in, made lots of money with and made him meet his first girlfriend. After 5 years, they get happily married and after another 5 years, they were a happy family with 2 kids and a dog. It all seemed fine and well until something terrible happened: his wife, kids and dog got in a car crash and none could survive it. the Boy became depressed and when he was about to pull the trigger, a computer fell down a building but survived the fall. It had a game playing on it, but what game? Goat Simulator. The Boy went to his lab and constructed a machine that could transfer his conciousness into a goat. He later stole a goat from somewhere and transferred his inner child and spirit into the goat, leaving a braindead human body and a goat that was running amok in the city, and he went to live happily ever after until an Animal Protection Agent had to put him down. The End.

Goat Simulator is Joke game that simulates you playing a Goat. You can butt, kick and lick many things in the map, and you can run, jump and lay down as movements. It has several things that you can ride also. It is a physics sandbox map game, where you go to explore, manipulate and destroy objects. Has Steam achievements, some easy, some hidden and some hard. Very funny game, but has No story or dialog. Simillar to a certain Skateboarding game, where you get score for doing tricks and destroying stuff. Will be buggy, lots of clipping objects and getting stuck. Has Steam workshop with mods available. You also get the Goat MMO simulator DLC for Free which parody the fantasy MMORPGs.  Buy it for a good laugh and to goof off for a few hours, but make sure you get it on Sale. I recommend the Goty Bundle on Sale, which has a DLC Soundtrack and 4 DLC that add a new themepark to play on, that parody some other popular game themes and adds reasons to play Goat sim for a couple hours each. Makes a good gift game.   For more info:         YouTube™ Video:  IGN Reviews - Goat Simulator - Review

just for starters DO NOT GET THIS GAME unless its on sale! i payed 15$ just for it to go on sale the next day. ok now on to the real review :D this game is vary fun and but also really glitch felled and sadly the game reuses almost every thing for almost everything if you got the game you would see what Im saying on that because there are only 3 real human npcs and they only say about 5 real things and the rest is ' oh look a goat how cute ' and get ready for lots of ragdolling in game because your goat well radoll if anything falls on top of you or if something runs into you to quickly. There are fun things to look for and do in the two main levels along with the things to find are power ups for your goat but when you use the power ups they can end up ragdolling your goat sending you far up into the air and turning your goat into a monster that looks like something from Dead Spase or some sick twisted game's final boss. The two main levels are varry small and you can quickly get from on end to the other you can do that even faster if your flying from somthing and its a little disappointing of how small they are and because of that there is not a lot of things to do in one map if you dont include the mini games. I cant really review the dlc because Iv played varry little of it but from what Iv seen and played from it is its varry hard. Over all my review looks like a negitve one but the game is fun because its embracing its badness by turning the complete game into a joke by having silly and odd things going on in the two small levels and also by having really good and wonderful easter eggs. So in the end I'd give Goat Simulator 8/10 BUT I'd only recommend getting it if its on sale ^_^ thank you for reading if you made it this far!

Goat Simulator is just stupid as hell, but it's unbelievably lovable because of that stupidity. As a matter of fact, the game itself is a PARODY of stupidity, and here is why.  As if playing as a goat in a video game wasn't appalling enough, said goat is evil and chaotic, and has but one mission: to wreak havoc on the human world. With Mutators that give him abilities that spoof other games ('Goatborn', a spoof of the Dragonborn in Skyrim, allows you to Fus-Ro-Dah! your way through anything, and 'Blue Streak' transforms you into Sonic the Goathog), and an open world that's pretty much made of Lincoln Logs, the goat can do all sorts of crazy but enjoyable stunts. You can run on walls (no, I'm not making that up. There is goat parkour), do backflips through windows, detach all of your bones and ragdoll on various surfaces, and much more.  It has DLC. Yes, a game about an evil goat has DLC. Said DLC is a very tongue-in-cheek parody on other real-world influences - its first (I think it was its first, at least) parody was 'GoatZ', that turns it into a low-budget mockery of the mockery known as DayZ. The descriptions of the DLC just speak volumes; it's mandatory to just read through those for a good laugh.  Goat Simulator is worth a buy if it goes on sale, since it's some good, cheap fun you can enjoy without much delay, so it's something you can do if you've got to go to work or school within like 10 minutes, but you're all ready to go so there wouldn't be anything else for you to do.

On February 11, 2006, then U.S. Vice President ♥♥♥♥ Cheney shot Harry Whittington, a 78-year-old Texas attorney, while participating in a quail hunt on a ranch in Riviera, Texas. Both Cheney and Whittington called the incident an accident.  The incident was reported to the Corpus Christi Caller-Times on February 12, 2006, by ranch owner Katherine Armstrong. The Bush administration disclosed the shooting incident to the public the afternoon of February 12. Local authorities released a report on the shooting on February 16, 2006, and witness statements on February 22.  On February 14, 2006, Whittington suffered a non-fatal heart attack and atrial fibrillation due to at least one lead-shot pellet lodged in or near his heart. Cheney did not speak publicly about the incident until February 15 in an interview with Fox News. Early reports indicated that Cheney and Whittington were friends and that the injuries were minor. Whittington later clarified that he and Cheney were not close friends but acquaintances.

This game deserves a cake.I will tell you,Coffee Stain,how to make one: Gather your ingredients. Pound cake is one of the simplest cakes to bake. Here's what you'll need: 1 cup unsalted butter, softened 1 cup sugar Pinch of salt 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 5 eggs 2 cups cake flour  2. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees.  3.  Grease a cake pan. Pound cakes are best baked in deep pans, such as loaf pans or bundt pans.  4. Cream the butter and sugar. Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat them together until the mixture is light, fluffy and creamy.  5. Add the eggs and vanilla. Keep beating the mixture until the eggs are completely incorporated.  6. Stir in the cake flour. Keep the hand mixer on low or use a wooden spoon to stir the flour in a bit at a time until it's just incorporated. Be careful not to overmix it.  7. Pour the batter into the pan. Use a spatula to scrape down the sides of the bowl.  8.  Bake the cake for an hour and 15 minutes. The cake is finished when a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.  Ingredients: 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter 2. 1/2 cup white sugar 3. 1/2 cup brown sugar 4. 1/4 cup water 5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon 6. 1 pinch salt 7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced 8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie   Directions: 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). 2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside. 3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices. 4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal. 5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust. 6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

This really game really was a hidden gem, not only is the main character a Horse but the storyline is written beautifully. The shooting mechanics are perfect and the hit markers indicate whether you have hit a person or not. The aim assist is extremely helpful and helps you when you are doing extremely well in multiplayer games when playing against your friends or random opponents. The ranking system is fenominal and very rewarding, when your character has reached a maximum rank you can throw all of your hard earned work away and do it all again... 15 times!! it's brilliant!  The multiplayer also offers killstreaks a system rewarded to players for there good plays In fact, the killstreaks themselves are evidence that the game's balance is truly there. Killstreaks have been expanded from the original Goat Simulator, now allowing players to unlock rewards such as stealth bombers, AC-130 strikes, EMP blasts, and even a devastating 25 killstreak nuke that ends the game with a big bang, automatically handing your team the win if you can pull it off.  The gameplay is smoother than ever you'll instantly get a sense of just how far the improved engine has come from the previous games.Goat Simulator is definitely more chaotic this time around – partially due to the new visual effects and upped production values – and with the improved enemy AI and tough scenario design you'll be fighting for every checkpoint. One of the larger visual changes to the game's heads-up display this time around is the blood splatter system, you'd get damaged, the screen would start to shade red, and you'd be required to seek cover before your vision returned to normal.   For the vast majority of the experience, Goat Simulator is best enjoyed with friends either locally or via online. The core campaign may have taken a bit of a hit, but in its place is an incredibly well done debut mode called Spec Ops. For those that don't know, Spec Ops mode is an arcade-inspired challenge mode that can be played single player for the most part (minus a few co-op specific challenges), but is obviously designed around two-person team play. The mode is broken up into five tiers, each with missions that have a possible three stars to gain based on difficulty level in each of the 23 missions. You'll see a lot of repeating areas, some pulled directly from the single-player campaign, but the actual objectives (and most of the time, the exact layout of the level) is all new. You won't find leaderboards for this mode, unfortunately.  When you look at the total package, Goat Simulator is hands-down one of the best first-person shooters out there, and a truly amazing offering across any system.For the strictly single player crowd, however, Goat Simulator is surprisingly short, and doesn't live up to the standard set by previous Goat Simulator games.  My final Verdict for this game is - 10/10 - IGN - Outstanding

You see, I don't understand why people say this is such a bad game. It's not meant to be a 50 hour gameplay session where you spend every day playing until the storyline is done. It's simply a game to mess around and occupy your time. And, in fact, it's more than smash this and lick this and destroy that. It has a bit more to it. The random bugs and glitches may make the game see like one of those crappy simulators like Baking Simulator, but Goat Simulator really isn't one of those games. I may not be one of those really judgemental gamers who pay close attention to every little detail, but that is what makes this game so enjoyable for me. I do like detail, especially in games like Prison Architect, though. Goat Simulator isn't one of those fancy run-of-the-mill games to excite everyone everywhere. It's fun, It really is. As you can see i've almost played 10 hours of it (Not all at once, of course, I am sane). I love this game, and recommend it for those who love games that are just random and...somehow awesome. But, I wouldn't recommend it to someone who loved fully detailed games that have storyline's, ect. :)

I have had this game for quite a while and have had many conflicting thoughts about it. Unfortunatly, the reason I am writing this review is because much of the time, Goat Simulator fails to start. After the first preview window is shown, the screen turns black and the game quits after 2 seconds in fullscreen. This problem has been going on for months now and I have a very hard time getting the game to launch. Sometimes, I restart my computer and that works, other times it does not want to launch for weeks, no matter what I do. Its getting to the point where I cant honestly reccommend this game due to the bugs that stop the game from functioning are never fixed.  Goat Simulator is a very interesting game that is fun and enjoyable. I just cant get it to work.  In case the dev team wants to fix it I am running a custom PC: Intel Core i7 4770K (not overclocked) with an Nvidia Gtx 770 reference (not overclocked).

To start, I went into this game competely blind thinking it was just another normal simulator game. When the game was started, it seemed like it was going to be a game following the normal life of a goat. That was the case until you collide with your first object and watch everything fall apart around you it was than that I realized that this was not going to be your average simulator. The entire world is yours to headbutt and lick from the people walking around to the hang gliders in the sky. This game will provide hours of entertainment as you live out your dreams of becoming a goat.

No real objective. Still REALLY funny and fun though. The only thing that bugs me is that the goat mmo isnt actualy an mmo, just a bunch of AI goats made to look like real people. there is chat but everyone talks about random things and no one responds to you. Thats how you can tell. But still the goat mmo is fun and so is the regular gamemode.

If you're like me you spend a lot of time thinking about goats. What do goats think? What would I do in this situation if I were a goat? Well wonder no more! Thanks to this amazing game these and many other goat related questions are answered! You can walk through town, travel to space, ride a rollercoster, and do many other goat things. The next stage in gaming is here!

after playing the MMO i have really fallen in love with this game. The mmo makes the game alot more better. Even though im having a problem with the old goat in goat mountain, im having a blast in the game. In fact i went 4 hours playing the game already before i realized i was playing it for 4 straight fun hours.  **NEW INFORMATION** After playing the MMO part of the game for the past few days i have come to the believe that the MMO part is NOT a MMO. Its great how they made it look like a MMO with npc's acting like players but it is NOT a actual MMO. Repeatly i have asked for help to do a quest and people ignore me in chat, i have said things in chat that people ignore BUT they all seem to be saying the same things over and over but as different names every time i log in. On top of it, when i do see these 'players' they all seem to follow similar paths and always be in the exact same spot. So even though it is great, lots of fun, it is NOT a actual MMO that has players you can interact with.

This game is pure silliness and a fantastic stress release; I was laughing for hours watching people run in terror as a goat blew up cars with nothing but its two horns, and seeing it fly like a doll as it was catapulted hundreds of feet through the air...only to get rigt back up as if nothing happened once its four hooves met the ground.  Is it worth the money though? Yes. Shooting things and cr ashing cars in a race is fun and can be 'relaxing' after a hard days work, but if you're like me and enjoy silly things (really silly things, borderline insane) then this game is the true cure for our itch. The way I look at it, I paid £2 per map and the spare change was for the overall 'game'. Considering many games charge £1.99 just for a key to unlock a crate you found, for one skin or item, makes this a bargain...especially since they charged nothing for the MMO update map or for the huge amount of skins and toys to play with.  +Just silly fun; you can blow things up and freely experiment with what you can do with the strange powers the goat has. +Although NPCs and the game will still call it a goat; you can play as an Ostritch, Penguin, Giraffe and even a Whale. +The dialogue from the NPCs matches the silliness of the game, making for some rather hilarious one-liners. +True freeroam; you don't have real quests or objectives tying you down, just a few little 'stunts' you can pull off for some completion satisfaction. = The music has a handful of tracks...literally. I counted approx 5 tracks in the game and they all sound silly and like something I would hear on shows like Ed, Edd and Eddy or Cow & Chicken. I personally love them because it just adds to the loony feel of the game (not that it needed to). But if you do not like repetative music then you might want to consider muting it. = The powerups you obtain stack up on the same, single key instead of being assigned new ones. This can be annoying to some people, and hilarious to others (like me). Some powerups when stacked together yield laggy and explosive results, so you have been warned. -Whilst I enjoy the 'broken' elements to the game; a lot of people do not. Sometimes your goat will get lodged in a wall, fall through the floor in an explosion or shoot out beynd the games boundaries. Thankfully you have a 'respawn' option should this happen, and once you learn what causes the breakages it is very easy to play the game without them happening. -Sometimes the game will lag in certain places or events, and any items you spawn do not go away unless you restart it (this is usually responsible for the lag). -Like the Stanley Parable, I enjoy this game in short bursts of 10-20 minute sessions before it becomes repetative and boring. Thankfully though the experiences you do have when you start the game are so enjoyable it doesn't leave you feeling mind-numbingly bored when you turn it off, but just amused and content...you broke that virtual house and it felt good, now it's time to clean up your real one. Hated doing that? Pop on Goat Simulator again and smash another house up or blow up someones car; it loads a heck of a alot faster than GTA does for those quick 'freak out and blow stuff up' sessions!  Overall I give the game an 8/10. I really enjoy it for it's silliness and it helps me vent my issues in a comedic and very enjoyable game. It has it's bugs and flaws, but for the price and experience it was totally worth it. Goat Simulator; not for the literal or logical. But for those who just do not give a crap about anything but blowing stuff up and crashing peoples parties. RUN PEASANTS.

I am actually going to do a somewhat 'real' review for this game, hard as that may be. But first, let me rant a bit. Now, i have no problem with people who dislike a game because the Developers were misleading with the description, or in any other way. I do, however, have a problem with people that buy a game and demand their money back despite them having the ability to see EXACTLY what they're buying. I know you know where this is going, so I’ll just get right to it. Goat Simulator has received a lot of bad press due to people like i described earlier. I mean, you can't not know what this game is going to be, and if the description isn't enough, you can always look up gameplay on YouTube. So, to all of the people who dislike this game because you bought it and were disappointed with what you got, suck it the heck up. You had everything you needed to be able to know what you were getting, so don't blame the developers, blame yourself. Now, to the actual review. Goat Simulator is a joke, and a pretty good one at that. I knew this game was going to be hilarious as soon as i was scrolling through Steam and saw 'Goat Simulator'. I immediately stopped what i was doing and proceeded to see what the heck this amazing gem was. I looked through the preview and the reviews, and i fell in love. This game, if the developers put in enough time, could be one of the funniest games of all time. Yes, it's not what i would call 'Game of the Year', but i would call it 'Goat of the Year' (See what i did there?). Now, i'm going to be serious for a second, it can get boring, but then, any game can. For $10, it is way worth it. I've had many, many laughs with my friends whilst playing this game, and i plan to have many more. My recommendation is to only buy this game if you know that it's a joke game, and you shouldn't expect anything less. Happy Goating!

Perhaps the most spectacularly hilarious game I've ever played. Goat Simulator puts you in control of a goat. You can headbutt, you can lick things and stick onto them, and you've got several worlds to explore, each ripe with hilarity. You can unlock new goats with new abilities, or just mess around and cause havok. There is no way to lose this game or play it incorrectly, so long as you have fun. That's all I'll say for now, since I'd rather people experience the game for themselves, or at least get their spoilers from people on the Interwebs who are funnier than me. Bottom line, this game is well worth it.

So this is Goat Simulator. It's a very glitchy game... but that's part of the fun! This game is a relatively-open-world simulation game, in which you take on the role of a goat. Your goal is to cry havoc and let loose the dogs of war... so to speak. Most of the items and objects in the game are able to be interacted with, whether this involves licking them, headbutting them, kicking them, blowing them up, etc. The game gives you objectives to complete at your leisure, but you don't need to complete any of them to thoroughly enjoy this game.  If you have glanced at some other reviews for Goat Simulator, you may find that some people do not recommend this game for people who are serious about gaming. I completely agree. This is the kind of game for people who like to have fun, and do not want to take their games too seriously. You can easily spend several hours just running around breaking things, hitting people, blowing things up, and never really accomplish anything.   However, that being said, if you are looking for a game that is hilariously fun to play, and can give you hours of entertainment with no real difficulty or challenge, this is the game for you. Goat Simulator is light-hearted, fun, and a very enjoyable way to pass the time. I would give it five thumbs up... except goat's don't have thumbs... damn. Oh! Alright, I give it four hooves up!

The devs are always adding more content, and there has been 2 major updates since release that were given for free which nearly doubled the in-game content each time. As for the paid DLC, that's worth it if you enjoy playing this.  This game is great for achievement hunting, finding secrets hidden throughout the levels, having a laugh, etc. It even has split-screen multiplayer to cause even more chaos with your friends!  Once you find everything, the replayability is meh, but the devs may have another update for it by the time you finish what is here already, plus Steam workshop support for player-made levels, which somewhat lack in quality, but are really fun if you find good ones.  So give this game a try, its a great physics sandbox, probably the second best on Steam (after GMod of course)

After playing countless hours of Sanctum, Super Sanctum TD, and Sanctum 2, I thought I'd support the devs and grab this game too. I'll start by saying that the game is intentionally rediculous in every single way. So much that I am left in constant doubt whenever something goes wrong because I cannot distinguish between intended features and bugs.  Now for the bad. Its obvious that the game wasn't meant to be played constantly all day every day. It will get boring after an hour, or maybe a few. Playing with friends can definitely alleviate this problem though. You really shouldn't purchase this game expecting to get more than 200 hours out of it within the next 3 years. That said, I still recommend it as a game to relieve some stress and just goof off for an hour or two, or maybe just hang out with some friend for a couple hours. This is not at all a serious game, and should not be taken seriously. This game is extremely oriented toward a casual audience.

It seems to be one of the ultimate boredom killers (I mean who wouldn't want to see a floppy goat who you control nearly kill itself over and over again?) and continues to make people laugh with its crazy physics and spoofs of popular game generes like mmos or zombie-oriented games. Goat Simulator  is one of those games that I describe as 'stupid fun.' The idea of exploring a decent sized map as a goat, causing as much destruction and chaos as possible sounds like a stupid idea, yet it's fun for the same reason. It's a game that's fun to unwind with and is bound to give you a good few chuckles, if not hysterical laughter.  This game's not for everyone, and isn't meant to be taken seriously.  If you're someone who thinks it's a waste of money, that's fine, you're entitled to that opinion. Just don't go around downtalking others for purchasing this game, because it's not your money, and therefore not your problem.

-Absurdity At Its Best-   When I first took a look at the name of the game while browsing various youtube channels I was taken back by how incredibly stupid the concept of the game was by name alone. But then I began to watch a few videos.   Very quickly it became clear that the name of the game is satirical. Which just stacks onto the humor I found the more I watched. Goats dragging cars along by their tongues. Another being flung into a gas station and the large destructive explosion that followed while 'Michael Bay!' popped up onto the screen in large purple text. The humour and sheer simplicity of it was astounding.   I very quickly decided I had to own it and stop watching videos before too much of this unexpected gem was sullied. The amount of simply stupid fun the game has to offer is amazing. The developers themselves say they didnt put much time or effort into this shining example of mold breaking. But whether its true or not the game is rife with genius. Putting yourself in the place of a single, immortal and invulnerable goat as you run amuck, headbutting, kicking and bleating your way throughout the medium sized section of town carving deep destruction along the way is completely entertaining and more than worth the price.   From destroying whats around you, goring nearby humans to just exploring your surroundings the game is just fun. It is also surprisingly full of things to discover and secrets to be learned.   Some functions in the game are unexpectedly entertaining to add to the mixture of the already humour ridden experience. I spent a good hour typing away into the Talk function just to exchange banter with a friend of mine in the room in the easily comparable Stephen Hawking 'voice'.   Topping it all off with the fact that with its current full release, Steam Workshop is fully available and the modding community will undoubtedly create massive quantities of additional absurd and hilarious add-ons to make the game fun for a long time to come.    So to wrap this all up. If you enjoy the simpler things. Or possibly a frankensteins monster mash-up of Tony Hawk, A-Typical Action&Adventure, and Rampage with the blood wiped away. This game is perfect.   You cannot go wrong.

Is $10 worth 2 hours of your time? If you answered 'yes' then you probably won't regret buying Goat Simulator. Let's be frank, there's not much to this game. You're a goat, except you can headbutt things with the force of a Mack truck, your tongue is supernarutally adhesive (allowing you to drag even massive objects around by licking them), and you're essentially invincible. The 'gameplay' is entirely achievement based, challenging you to do ever more insane things with your god-like goat abilities to accomplish increasingly difficult goals and rack up massive amounts of points. In this respect the game is like a Tony Hawk skateboarding game with one map and instead of a guy on a skateboard, you're a goat.  Goat Simulator is just dumb fun and if you can get past the bugs and lack of content, then you'll probably be able to plumb a few hours of ridiculous fun out of this title. With the promise of Steam Workshop community content in the future, there is a definite possibility of Goat Simulator offering up tons of new and outrageous scenarios. The only question is: are you goat enough?

Notices: The level of simulation can become greulingly intense for personal computers, so expect some lag and crashing on older/newer machines. When I was in the womb my twin, who was a goat fused, with me, causing me to become part goat by the time I was born. However the doctors insisted that I could only be either goat or human, and my parents decided they wanted a normal child. All my life I dreamed I could once again be a goat, thanks to this next-generation in simulation technology I can live out the part of my life that was so violently cut away from me.

This simulator has finally allowed me to live my deepest goat fantasies. No longer must I wonder what its like to be one of these majestic creatures. The developers have done the impossible, to embody the magnificence of human evolution into a single goat. With stunning visuals, sounds and a memorable storyline this will be remebered as the masterpeice that defined out exsitance.   11/10 baaaaa

Is $10 worth 2 hours of your time? If you answered 'yes' then you probably won't regret buying Goat Simulator. Let's be frank, there's not much to this game. You're a goat, except you can headbutt things with the force of a Mack truck, your tongue is supernarutally adhesive (allowing you to drag even massive objects around by licking them), and you're essentially invincible. The 'gameplay' is entirely achievement based, challenging you to do ever more insane things with your god-like goat abilities to accomplish increasingly difficult goals and rack up massive amounts of points. In this respect the game is like a Tony Hawk skateboarding game with one map and instead of a guy on a skateboard, you're a goat.  Goat Simulator is just dumb fun and if you can get past the bugs and lack of content, then you'll probably be able to plumb a few hours of ridiculous fun out of this title. With the promise of Steam Workshop community content in the future, there is a definite possibility of Goat Simulator offering up tons of new and outrageous scenarios. The only question is: are you goat enough?

Alright, serious review:  You may think this game is dumb, but dammit, its fun for what it is. The devs are always adding more content, and there has been 2 major updates since release that were given for free which nearly doubled the in-game content each time. As for the paid DLC, that's worth it if you enjoy playing this.  This game is great for achievement hunting, finding secrets hidden throughout the levels, having a laugh, etc. It even has split-screen multiplayer to cause even more chaos with your friends!  Once you find everything, the replayability is meh, but the devs may have another update for it by the time you finish what is here already, plus Steam workshop support for player-made levels, which somewhat lack in quality, but are really fun if you find good ones.  So give this game a try, its a great physics sandbox, probably the second best on Steam (after GMod of course)

Goat Simulator is fun, but in astupid fun kind of way. Now, I personally don't have a good enough computer and so I lag horribly, but I still struggle through the intense lag in order to play it. Goat Simulator is basically like one of those games that a group of friends made for fun, but it is still amazing. This game has comedy, great physics, great and immense controls, and endless possibilities despite the map being so small. The map includes a great many things for you to ♥♥♥♥ around with, including a castle with goat followers in it, a dried up pool with trampolines in it, a group of protesters, a goat version of Fight Club, a satanic ritual, a Zero Gravity Simulation area, a construction site, and even includes the office (which is actually just in a house) of the developers. What's more is that you can play an even more ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t game than Flappy Bird called Flappy Goat. If you ask me, this game is totally worth the ten dollars. Buy it if you want hours upon hours of endless and stupid fun.

Have you ever wanted to be a goat? A goat that could brace impact from any amount of height. One that is an acrobatic goat. Of course you do! As I spawned into the game I thought 'I'm a goat. I can do whatever my heart desires' (The side of my heart that always told me to be a goat when I grew up as a child). So I grazed. I grazed day and night non stop. my whole family has left me because of my addiction to this game. My addiction to, well grazing. I play to feel the rush of pure excitement while feeling the texuture of the juicy, lush grass.  It has been 3 weeks now. I cant feel my fingers my eyes twitch from sleepless nights. But I must graze on. My mother has sent in paramedics becuase I havent ate since buying this game. They ask me why I find this game entertaining. BUT THEY DO NOT KNOW HOW IT FEELS TO PLAY THIS GAME! I passed out and am in the hospital. They say that I might die. But I feel perfectly healthy.   I cant take it. my head is throbbing and I cannot feel my arms or legs. They say I have a tumor from staring at the screen non stop. They say I must stay longer. Thats when I lost it I thrashed my arms flailing them everywhere. I ran far, far into the forest. Tired I fall asleep and wake the next day. I HAVE HORNS AND HOOVES. I understand now. To play as a goat you have to be a goat, so I find a group of goats to hang with for the rest of my life. I think they like me.  I STRONGLY RECOMMEND NOT PLAYING THIS GAME IF YOU DONT WANT TO BECOME A GOAT.

At long last, my prayers for a way for me to virtually become a goat were answered when I found out about this game. Unfortunately, due to the costs of my ever-growing goat paraphenalia collection and the money I have been putting aside for a future goatplasty procedure, paying full retail price was not in my budget. But you can bet it was in my library moments after the price dropped for the summer sale. I could not contain my excitement to finally step into this wonderous world and explore the infinite goatastic possibilities it had to offer. And it certainly does not disappoint.  In a few words: Goats. Parkour. Explosions. Discovery. Power-ups. Headbutting. Transcendence.

Within ten minutes of booting this game, I was standing on top of a construction crane wearing a crown, a jet-pack, and an automatic pitching machine. Jumping from the crane, I landed on the back of a hang-glider, licked the occupant, and rode him down into a gas station. The gas station exploded, and the words 'MICHAEL BAY' flashed on the screen.  Later, I rode a rollercoaster, played with fireworks, and did some sweet skateboard tricks.
You get to Goat all you want. There are many ways to Goat, and this lets you do all of them. 10/10: give it your money.

My first reaction to this simulator was disappointment. I've always had a desire to be a goat and thus this seemed made for me, but the eternally dangling tongue and that improbable neck put me off. However, I had already spent my money and was determined get its worth. As I continued to play, I found myself more and more immersed in the role. I soon realized that the life of a goat is not so clean and even. After all, one can't expect a creature whose primary means of interacting with the world is headbutting to be so constantly composed. I found the surface details easy to ignore once I'd managed to reach the top of the tallest structure from which I could look down on all the known world. While the contents of an entire house swirled around me as I headbutted, kicked, and licked, I had forgotten those vulgarities completely. Then that flurry somehow flung me out of the house and into the clouds. At that moment, I was the goat and it was ecstasy.

Some people call this Pewdiebait, a game made for youtubers so they can play around with it, make it popular and then make lots of money off a game that's actually not very good. I want to punch people who call Goat Simulator Pewdiebait in the face. Goat Simulator is an april fools joke, hence the release on april fools, and made for fun of both developer and player. It's a game where the developers don't take themselves or their game very seriously, thus it's full of weird glitch which some people may dislike, but in most cases it will put a smile on your face. Almost every game you have places where you think 'If only I could *insert random action here* '. Goat simulator allows you to do whatever you wanted to. Wanna beat up the teenage mutant ninja turles? Sure. Wanna overcharge a rollercoaster? Why not. Wanna sacrifice humans to become Satan? Go ahead, the sacrificial circle is in the corner. WANT TO MAKE IT RAIN WHALES? YOU FREAKING CAN!   The game itself has 3 maps, being 2 cities and the map of the MMO simulator (It's not really an MMO, it simulates an MMO. You can play together though) while you can add any map you want from the workshop. The MMO simulator really has many many funny parts, better graphics than WoW (Really, the elven town is amazing) and even a fun little secret where you can bust the MMO's servers and reduce the world to Wireframe.  So all together this game has lots to offer in terms of sandbox and lame puns, and it will keep you satisfied for quite some time and the collectible hunters will keep on collecting in this amazing game.

An open world game like no other...you can be a goat, and you can do anything you want as a goat. Here are some of the goat related things I found that you can do:     You can become an ostrich.     You can become a giraffe.    You can tongue-ride a roller coaster.    You can be ridden by a human while riding a mechanical bull.    You can blow stuff up.    You can ride a bike.    You can fall off a bike.    You can go to space.     You can get owned by hillbillies.    You can get owned by a treadmill.    Two words: Bacon. Beacon.    You can lick people and turn them into watermelons that explode.    You can summon peasants.    You can be the hero this city needs, not the hero it wants... Mangoatbatgoatman.    That last one was a lie.    Actually, that might be in the game and I just haven't found it yet.    You can carry around a baseball launcher and hit people.     Double-jump!     You can gain demonic powers by sacrificing humans.    Bacon. Beacon.    Scateboarding.     Ragdoll skateboarding.     Zero gravity testing facilities.    Invisible walls!     There's a helicopter in the second map, I haven't licked it yet but I bet you can.    Fas Ro Baah!    Press the any key!    Stop reading dumb lists and just buy the game.

A great game for stoners, but otherwise there's not a lot of game content, just a great physics sandbox with workshop potential. I bought it during the summer sale so it was definitely worth my money, though I probably wouldn't have purchased it for $10. Goat Simulator isn't a game that you 'play' per se. You really experience this game more than play it. You interact with the world with your goat-ly senses and actions.  This game is simulation game, just as the title implies. There's really not much to 'play' in this game. There is the MMO update thing that added what seems like a World of Warcraft parody mode that you can enjoy with other players, but I generally find this game hard to focus on any kind of story or specific story-goals or anything given the outrageous nature of a game where you control a goat for entertainment.  The game isn't great, but that part of what makes it fun to play. There are bugs and issues, and they are intentionally left in the game, for better or worse.  There is a lot to do and a lot of controls to learn as you play, but there are a lot of fun little collectibles and events you can partake in (goat fight anyone?). The game is outrageous, it's funny, it's stupid, it's generally a waste of whatever money you spend on it.  That said, if it's on sale or something and you've got the money to spare to try it out, give it a go. It's not a complete waste of time if you're at least a little interested in the first place.  I recommend this game, but with caution that many people will find it stupid, pointless and wasteful. The rest of you will certainly have a good bit of fun for a while with it.

Baa~! Goat Simulator! This isn't about sitting around a farm, baaing, eating grass, and living a peaceful life except for those horrible people who come around to try and make you faint.   This is about living the life YOU want to live, oh and... Messing. stuff. up.   Maybe you've had enough of being a land dweller, so you strap on that jet pack and blast into the sky. The jet pack is just one out of several special powers.  I don't know what kind of goat research Coffee Stain Studios did, but I feel as if they truly learned what a goat wants (what a goat needs), like riding on a carnival ride...   Or, maybe you'd prefer to be the goat of goats and complete in this bloody goat vs. goat battle that reminds me of the fighting pits in Game of Thrones. (I didn't win.)  There are two cities, Goatville and Goat City Bay, and you also have Goat Simulator MMO which is like a MMO except you only deal with bots and not real people (which can be a plus). There is also brand new DLC, GoatZ, where you can be part of the zombie apocalypse. Go forth, and baa-sh in some zombie heads. (Jen and I don't have this yet, sadly.) Moving on!   Sometimes a goat's just gotta break up a party... Ride a bike... Blow stuff up, and so on.   With Goat Simulator MMO, you can pick your class, I quite like Magician, go on quests, and explore.  Really, you can spend hours exploring everywhere (Goatville, Goat City Bay, and the MMO world.) You can enter houses, too! I like headbutting my way through people's houses. (So baa-d.)  There's a load of achievements as well, so if love them like I do, you're definitely in luck. I have unlocked 8 out of 87. I have a lot of work to do!  I highly recommend giving Goat Simulator a try! It's worth the $9.99 (I mean, seriously.)  Goat Simulator is fun, funny, and addictive. I promise hours of enjoyment, and I hope you have an absolute baalast if you play.

Goat Simulator is the latest in goat simulation technology, bringing next-gen goat simulation to YOU. You no longer have to fantasize about being a goat, your dreams have finally come true! WASD to write history.   Gameplay-wise, Goat Simulator is all about causing as much destruction as you possibly can as a goat. It has been compared to an old-school skating game, except instead of being a skater, you're a goat, and instead of doing tricks, you wreck stuff. Destroy things with style, such as doing a backflip while headbutting a bucket through a window, and you'll earn even more points! Or you could just give Steam Workshop a spin and create your own goats, levels, missions, and more! When it comes to goats, not even the sky is the limit, as you can probably just bug through it and crash the game. Disclaimer Goat Simulator is a completely stupid game and, to be honest, you should probably spend your money on something else, such as a hula hoop, a pile of bricks, or maybe pool your money together with your friends and buy a real goat. Key Features You can be a goat  Get points for wrecking stuff - brag to your friends that you're the alpha goat  Steam Workshop support - make your own goats, levels, missions, game modes, and more!  MILLIONS OF BUGS! We're only eliminating the crash-bugs, everything else is hilarious and we're keeping it  In-game physics that bug out all the time  Seriously look at that goat's neck  You can be a goat Mac and Linux Disclaimer The Mac and Linux ports are still in Beta. Expect problems. We're working on fixing them asap!

It's a fun game but the vanilla version is really lacking. It has very little content and could benefit a lot from more maps, game modes or just more things to do in general. I understand the developers want to benefit from all the work they put into the DLCs but as I said the vanilla game has very little content and often than not leaves you pretty bored after playing the game for a little while. It would be nice if they could update the vanilla game with more content instead of passing it of as DLC. I think Goat Simulator has a lot of potential and could possibly become one of the most fun crash course/sandbox games on steam if it wasn't so lacking.  I'm recommending it because despite what I said, the game is fun even though the fun doesn't last very long.

I love this, but if it were more expensive I'd give it a miss. It's a curiosity, a novelty, and a bit of fun. If you like games involving exploration and discovery, this provides it plus many laughs along the way. I've sunk a few hours into this game so far and was entertained the whole time. Also, if you don't have a sense of humour, avoid it. You'll find it pointless and banal.  I must also mention the graphical glitches, however I think these have been left in intentionally to add to the humour. The opening instruction to 'Press The Any Key' sums it up, really.  For £6.99p I felt it was worth snapping up. Any more than that and I'd have felt short changed.

Wow this game is amazing! i now have 2 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ hours of gameplay on my computer and guess what. i havent seen anything but the icon that i click to (not) launch the game. if you enjoy seeing a program that almost starts and triggers the animation for the icons in your bar to move aside for another running program and after 0.1 seconds decides to not even give you the pleasure of looking at its icon inside the beautiful boarder of an active running program then this is the game for you! if you actually wanted to see more than a black goat icon (for example an actuall loading screen) you've come to the wrong place.  + beautiful black goat icon + builds up incredible tension with making you think the game would actually launch + shows up in your steam library so people know how cool you are + no loading time + no ads + uses no ram or processing power to run in the background so you can farm those playing hours and show your friends how cool you are (again)   - 1.8 GBs for a black goat icon - not more than a black goat icon - makes me feel sorry for all the goats that cant be launched (like the game) - lack of graphics - lack of gameplay - lack of actuall game - lack of everything but the icon   This game has amazed me so far. I've always wanted to know how it felt to be a goat and this game has opened my eyes! It must feel horrible to be born and only live for 0.1 seconds. It brought up so many questions for me. From now on i will treat every goat with a 100% of my respect for its 0.1 second long life.   UPDATE!!! Redownloaded the game. It now actually works.

Super fun game I bought when it first came out. Not for everyone, but hey, some people can't appreciate a silly sandboxy game. A lot of the fun comes from seeing something and getting an idea for some silly stunt ('Is it possible to backflip off of that building and lick the helicopter on my way down?') then trying to pull it off, or going through and trying to find every easter egg. And boy are there are lot of easter eggs.  I recommend you buy just Goat Sim and try it before adding Goat Z, since if you don't enjoy the regular game I doubt you'll like the add on very much, but if you liked the original definitely buy Goat Z too! It's worth the extra five bucks. It adds a huge map with just as much in it as if not more than the original map the game started out with and an entirely new game mode (Survival Mode), that's actually kind of challenging if anyone who was hoping for a game with more direction that run around and be silly.  You might get bored of it after a while, but just come back to it again after a while when you need something to do and it's just as fun as the first time.  Contains goats, aliens, zombies, elephants, MMORPGs, and Satanic rituals. 10/10

Absolutely ridiculous. If it was a full-priced game, I wouldn't reccomend it. However, for ten dollars, this is pretty dang decent! There are lots of easter eggs and unlockables, although the gameplay is quite linear. You can't play for more than an hour or so without becoming bored, but it is a great time waster and stress reliever. The bugs aren't game-breaking, (although the game does crash on me once every five times I play.) There are various wall clips and bugged physics, but they are overseeable, because goat. The graphics are nearly 8th-gen standard, if you turn up the settings. Really though, the game relishes in its own bugginess, accepts it, and makes it ironic. And that contributes to its disgusting beauty.  *Edit* There's so much DLC now. I wouldn't cough up another 20 bucks or so for all of it. In Goat Simulator, you play as a... Goat.  It is sort of a sandbox game because you choose what to do and there's no real story. I took it for it's full price, which is totally worth it, and started playing. First of all, you have more than one game mode : you have the sandbox and a sort of MMO (but with DLC, you have more of them), which are both really fun and contain a few quests and achievements.  Now, let's get to the rating :   GOOD FOR :  - Graphics : entire city models and a huge village in MMO ;  - Easy to understand and awesome gameplay : for starters, you can learn how to play in less than a minute ;  - Listening community : making the game great again (and again, and again...) ;  - Gravity enhanced simulator : the game is realistic ;  - Small memory hunger : it's not a fatty ;  - Crazy stunts : 'you gotta lick it all !' ;  BAD FOR :  - A few crashes with less than 8 GB of RAM allowed on your computer ;  - ****ed up houses and demon communities.  CONCLUSION :  9/10 : would lick you again.
