Obviously, Goat Simulator was never meant to be anything more than an interactive joke in the world of games. And as a joke, it exceeds all expectations.   However, as a game that is for sale it falls short of reasonable expectations. After all of 30 minutes, the novelty of 'I can run up to X and headbutt it' passes. With that passing comes the realisation of just how shallow the game really is.

First off, I'd like to say that Goat Simulator was a bit fun. However, after 20 minutes, I had completed most of the challenges, with only 2 left (The one where you get a lot of points). I don't believe this game is worth the asking price ($9.99) because it lacks so much.

Like a lot of other people i thought it looked fun from youtube videos.  Don't, just don't.   If you're here because you saw a youtube video where it looks like they're having fun. Don't get it.  You explore a bit, scare some people, bounce on a bouncy castle and then you realised that's the extent of the fun.  Within about an hour your frame rates will drop stupidly, even on a good computer and you'll reset the game out of frustration.  The glitches are quaint for about fifteen minutes, the music will drive you nuts and you'll go and play a different game, having lost a few quid.  Seriously at most this is worth about £1 of fun.  Got get Little and Big instead, it'll probably be cheaper, it's fun for longer and it has story.
I mean it was fun for 15 minutes...

Pros:  • Very fun at first • Nice Openworld • Steam Workshop • Pretty Graphics, very nice for an Indie Title  Cons:  • Gets boring extremely fast • Little to no diversity • Limited Possibilities on Workshop • Vastly Overhyped and very Disappointing   Goat Simulator has own basic Formula: Be a Goat. Thats it. You boot up the game, spend the first 15 Minutes in wild ecstasy destroying greenhouses and such, explore the map, discover the different buttons, mess with the inhabitants for a while, and congratulations, youve played Goat Simulator.  Even though there are some achievements that are moderately fun to achieve, they become old and pointless quickly, and you are left waiting for someone to create a decent Map/Mod to spice things up a bit.   If youre looking for a really, really casual game that you can play for 15 every week for some fun, go for it. The Price is low enough, and youll get what youre looking for. However, if youre looking for a game that doesnt treat you like someone impressed by anything, if youre looking for a challenging, addictive and witty game to play to death, you should definitely pass on this one.

The humor will wear off quick unless you've somehow never played with ragdoll physics before.

This game is honestly the biggest buyer's remorse I've ever had fo a game. It's funny... For five minutes. I'd bought it for about £7 and spent ten minutes on it before getting bored. The controls are pretty terrible. It's a pain trying to control the goat and get it to do what you want it to. The game itself is also pretty glitchy.  The joke wears thin very fast, which is the game's main selling point. I mean, there's only so many times you can watch a goat blow up. The worst thing about it is the price. In no way is this game worth £7. This is the most I've spent on a game on Steam (I'm not a heavy PC gamer) and it's the only game I feel I've wasted money on.  I don't really recommend this game at all but if you desperately must try it, please don't spend over £3 for it.

There are a lot of silly simulator games out there, and this is one of them. Some of the silly ones were good, even Surgeon Simulator was good, because it was silly and funny, but it was also actually slightly difficult, and was actaully a game. This game is not really that difficult, but it does have some good and bad traits to it. You can play as an animal, which is awesome! There are a lot of hard achievements to get (as well as some very easy ones), and it's a stupid simulator game.  You can play as an animal in this game, which I love. It's so hard to find games in which you can play as an animal, and that is the reason I bought this game in the first place, and in the terms of playing as an animal it really fufills it's goal. Not only can you play as a goat, but you can also play as a dinosaur, a penguin, a giraffe and a whale. As whatever you play, you can make noises and act as an animal destroying things.  The achievements can be quite difficult or quite easy, the early achievements are obviously very easy, but as in any game, they get harder.Checking the achievement stats, you can see that a lot of people haven't gotten qutie a few easy achievements, which makes it clear the people who play this game don't play it for the achievements. The big problem with the achievements are that you cannot get all of them unless you buy the other DLC for this game, such as the 'GoatZ' one, or the 'Payday 2' one. When there was just one DLC it was fine, but now they have released a lot more stupid DLC that has made it harder and harder to get more of the achievements. Having all the achievements to collect makes it more and more fun to replay the game and try and get the achievements.  This is obviously a stupid simulator game, but you don't always need to play it as one. No matter what the game, you are always the one who chooses to play the game a certain way, no one is forcing you to play this game in a stupid way, and headbutt things, and go all ragdoll everywhere. You are playing the game like that, and there's nothing wrong with playing the game like that, as it is a sandbox game. But there's also nothing wrong with trying to get all the achievements, it's just another way to play. But despite all that, it is a stupid simulator game, and that also means it has a lot of spontanious references to mainstream things, like Minecraft, The Hitch Hikers Guide To The Galaxy, and deadmau5. These references are at first slightly funny, as it's a reference that you know and it's in a game. But at the same time it's about as funny as Saints Row 3 or 4, it's the type of funny that is splewn across the later Saints Rows games, it's not as funny as it would have been if it was a more serious game, but with the references still in there. Having a more serious game with small funny things works more than a funny game with funny things.  In the end, I can't recommend this game, as this game only draws in people who just want to experience something spontanious, and not by people who want achievements (because of the low stats) and most likely not by people who like playing animals in games (as there isn't as much of a demand for those games). If you want to play a simulator game for the silliness of the game, you could play Surgeon Simulator, as it is a much more fun game, a game with references and still a lot more difficult to play than Goat Simulator. Although this game can be quite fun to play multiplayer, so unless you want to paly an animal, collect achievements or play multiplayer, then you should not buy this game, as it gets old quickley.

What is Goat Simulator?  Recently there has been a lot of hype revovling around this game for its randomness and such, but is it really worth it to buy and play? Better question, will this game last you a long time, or at least long enough to get maybe a decent amount of hours in before your sick of it? For I regretably found the creul truth of this game, it's just not enough fun. There isn't nearly enough fun, wacky things to do as a goat in this game to keep you occupied. Of course, just as I did, you'll have an hour or so when you'll say something like'BEST GAME EVER!', later you'll find out it's more of a in the moment feeling. I did have a good hour or so when it felt like it was so much fun, not knowing what to screw up as a goat next, but then very soon it was evident, the game got boring. (THE GAME LIVES OFF THE FACT OF YOU BEING A GOAT TOO MUCH!!!)  What do you do in the game?  The game consists of you, a goat, being well, a goat. You basically terrorize a small(and I mean SMALL) town and do what ever you really feel like whether it's ruin a family's dinner or grab a big boulder with your tounge and hurt stuff(kind of fun). Your main things you can do are move around with the W,A,S,D keys(duh), run with the shift key, use the E key to grab to stuff with your tounge and take it somewhere(maybe out for dinner?) and of course jump with the SPACE BAR. Also as you do more things in the game more small abilities unlock like the GOATBORN, which is basically you being able to Fus Ro Da as a goat, which I admit, can be fun.  Should I Buy This Game?  Really I don't know if I can tell you the answer completly, but I may be able to push a little towards my idea of the situation. This game is is fun for only how long you let it be fun. By that I mean it's fun only if you sort of have an imagination or like just messing around with no real incentives, or goals. Personally, when I play a game I feel I need some sort of goal to push towards and acheive because well that's sort of what makes a lot of games fun. Now there are a few small 'goals' you can do, but nothing really worth going into depth like doing a backflip, but earning nothing in return, horay. So if you want to spend 10$ on this game go ahead, just remember, the game in a nutshell dosen't have much substance to it so it won't last long if you don't like just messing around.  NOTE: Also just like to note that there isn't any multiplayer, but there is a workshop kind of thing where you can doownload other people's maps, which could grant a few more hours of play.   VERDICT: 7/10 It's Ok  Pro Your a goat Gives you a good laugh Only 10$(Could also be a con couldn't though?) Good if your bored one afternoon and have nothing to do   Con Causing destruction and such gets old after a while Graphics glitch out(I realize that it's suppose to be in the game, but can be annoying) No goals or at least anything really worth striving to do  Costs 10$

Goat simulator is a peculiar beast, for some, it is funny, and for some, it is a boring game. I find it quite boring, and for one simple reason. Writing a game about a bug makes that bug not funny, and quite redundant. Let me overview this game's aspects.  Gameplay - 6/10 The gameplay revolves around exploiting the game's physics, bashing things and making them collide and clip through objects, and licking stuff, making things spaz out.  Story - 0/10 There is none.  Graphics - 5/10 Many textures are muddy, and while the lighting is not bad, this looks like a game from 2010.  Humour - 2/10 I just don't find it funny. The whole game's humour revolves around 'wackyness' and internet memes and humour, which I simply don't find that funny. I hate not reccomending games, but I need to describe who this game might appeal to, and that person isn't myself. If you are not like me, then you might like this game.  I enjoy mechanics, exploring, and occasionally story. So why did I get Goat Simulator? A friend told me of the MMO aspect of the game, which is a faux MMO of sorts or a parody of it. I loved the concept. And when I played it I thoroughly enjoyed it for 10-20 minutes. I then left it alone, uninstalled it, and then reinstalled it after awhile. I then played the MMO part again and the base game and found it temporarily enjoyable. I liked exploring a bit, but that joy ended quickly (not much to explore in the base game), and the MMO part lost the funny appeal part to me.  Basically, I got this game because I explored it fairly easily, the mechanics were...goat-like I guess? And obviously it has no serious story. I wasn't expecting any of that to a degree, but from the MMO aspect I was expecting more parody like elements that actually worked in some way without it just being similar absurd mechanics across the spectrum. My friend found something in it that I didn't see after playing it for awhile.  So let me put it this way, if you enjoy almost absolute absurdity, then this game is for you. I'm still glad I bought the game though.

This game is $10. It's hilarious and a very interesting concept. Why am I giving it a negative review then?  1) As a message to the developers, bugs aren't always good. Some of the bugs are funny, yes, but there are so many bugs that the game runs very poorly. It can even go under 60 FPS, which is just terrible for a PC game.  2) The world size is ridiculously small. As an open-world physics sandbox, I am looking for something a lot larger with a lot more to do. With how small this world is, the game only provides about one hour of minimal entertainment, even with all of the modifiers you can give your goat.  3) Once again concerning how little entertainment the game gives, there's not much to actually DO. The game is very repetative. If you're looking for a game to spend hours playing, be ready to spend hours head-butting and licking the same things over and over again.  4) The game price is horrible. It's not worth $10 at all. The only reason I bought it is because I thought it looked funny, Youtubers made it look fun (Yes, this game is obvious Youtuber bait), my siblings wanted it as well, and it was on sale for $5. Even $5 for this game is a bit ridiculous because of how horrible it runs.  Please, don't make the same mistake that I did and waste your money on this game. It's not worth it, at all.  2/10

this isn't a game, it's a bad physics simulator.   it's just stuff smashing together and exploding in a considerably less satisfying manner than you'd expect from what is essentially a physics-demo-toy.  the humor is gunning for the youtube set as hard as possible, everything is forced puns and memes and self-congratulatory ♥♥♥♥ that got old for me almost immediately.  all of that would be forgivable if it was a decent physics engine but it really isn't. nothing has the proper weight and the soft bodies have no bones so everything goes wiggly right away.  if your idea of pants-pissingly hilarious is a goat flopping around with its tongue out until you push a button to make it stop, this is the executable program for you.  if that sort of thing sounds like it might get old within five minutes of starting up, you should probably ignore the alarming degree of fanwank this is getting and wait until it goes on super-Steam-sale for $0.99 to see what all the fuss is about.

I don't remember how much I paid for Goat Simulator, but thinking about it now, it was too much. This game really should be $1 or free/pay-what-you-will. If you are a fan of Tony Hawk Pro Skater, you will probably get about 1 hour or less of entertainment from Goat Simulator. I have 3.2 hrs played, and It probably will never get above 3.5. The levels are very small, and you can run around each one in a minute or two. The only objective in the game is to destroy things and cause mayhem, getting points and combos which unlock new 'goats' and new goat powers which you can optionally turn on. These new goats and powers only add the slightest amount of variety, as the level you are in has all the same things to interact with that it already did. I imagine that you would need a very short attention span to enjoy this, because literally all you can do in the game is headbutt and flail around, its fun for about 10 minutes, and then if youre really bored you go around the level to find the numerous buggy and glitchy 'easter eggs', which are really the only content. These do not accomplish anything in adding to the game, its the old makeup on a pig.  To sum it up, its a joke that is probably funniest when you see a video of someone play it, the fun level only goes down from there, it feels like something I should not have paid for.

I guess if you are absolutely bored and have nothing to do, it can pass some time since it doesn't really have a goal and you won't get sucked into it like other games, but can occupy you.  Most of it's charm comes from it's references. Those are pretty much where all the humor comes from. Sure the physics may be silly, but it feels like there isn't enough to play around with to get enough laughs.  The map is actually surprisingly small. I initially thought it would have more to do. You see a city in the backbround, but unfortunately, you can't got to it. That would have been a fun enviroment to play in, but unfortunately, it's just not part of the one map. Also, the developers put in houses that you CAN'T enter. There are only two houses you can enter: The one you spawn in front of, and the Coffee Stain Studios one. I just find it kind of stupid how you have a small map, and make it a tiny bit smaller by having useless un-enterable buildings.  It's also sucks how the civilians are pretty much another object. In a game like GTA, it's fun to wreck havoc because there is a whole bunch of people and you can go on a blood thirsty rampage and watch the civilians flee. Then cops show up and try to kill you and you then have even more people and things to blow up. The civilians here are kind of few, and they just don't do much. They may make screams, but they don't really run away all that much.  It also seems like it is a hog when it comes to CPU power. Unfortunately, I can't really say much on this, since I don't have a super expensive gaming rig, but apparently some people say they have a good gaming rig and they don't get as much framerate as they normally do. But still, I feel that hardly matters, since it seems like it's still playable even on my laptop, albeit it's on low settings.  I do like how the developers capitalize on the fact that it endorses bugs. That is funny to see at first, but when you get down to it, it kind of ruins the gameplay a bit. If you see a funny stretchy body bug in something like Fallout or Halo or Gears of War, or most other games, it's funny too see because that is an unintended result, and things are funny to us when we don't expect it. But, when you get those spazzy body physics in this game, you know that's what the game intends and it just isn't that funny.  It feels like this game is not worth 10$. Maybe more like 5$. But still, who knows. This game does have workshop, so maybe enough people can make fun and amusing maps to play on or some fun functions and features, and that can save this game. But of course, that is assuming that the people who are devent at making maps and what not don't get bored of this game to the point where they don't want to work on it anymore. But still, it doesn't matter so much to the developers. They already made a ♥♥♥♥ ton of money from this. It was advertised well and a lot of people boarded the hype train. I was one of the passengers. Now I am in a place I don't want to be and can't get my money back.  TL;DR It's only worth half it's price, and it seems to be lacking in a lot of areas. Meh physics. It sold well because of good advertising and hype. Can provide two hours of fun, and can possibly pass a short amount of time every so often if you need something to do or waiting for something.

To be honest, this game is exactly what you pay for. I payed $10, and the game was worth $10. The game would be much better if it were $20; then it might be a better game.  It's fun at first. You can headbutt people off of buildings and lick them. Pretty funny. There's even an MMO part where you can do quests and interact with other goats.   But then it gets kind of repetitive. You're doing the same things over and over again. It's also pretty annoying when you glitch into something and can't fix it unless you restart the game.  If you REALLY like headbutting, licking, and pushing people, and enjoy doing it repeatedly, then I recommend this. If you like games with more complexity, and hate glitches, then I do not recommend this.

The game is good, but I have a problem with the company.  They said all DLC would be free but the zombie one is not. I understand that a company and people need money to carry on, but they never posted anything about changing their policy on not charging for DLC until the day before or of release for the zombie DLC. I wish I could get my money back now, but I got it for cheap, so whatever.  The game doesn't have too much playability in my opinion. It's a novelty. That's what it is...and free DLC would have kept the novelty somewhat new, but now that I must pay and do not have the ability to, well, the novelty has worn off for me. So for those like me that need more variety than basic mayhem and destruction with no plot (I didn't expect plot mind you) this is not the game for you unless they keep coming out with DLC that you're willing to pay for (which the DLC just looks, to me, to be the original game....except you're a diseased goat instead of just a goat.)

This game is just terrible. Controversially, you don't actually play as a goat. You play as a unity asset. The controls are terrible and there is really no gameplay. To put in perspective, I paid just $2.50 for this game and I still asked for a refund. Yeah, I paid that much for another game that wasn't that great, but at least it had good controls and some solid gameplay. That game, I didn't mind paying for. Don't buy this if you are looking for a game. Don't buy this if you're looking for goat simulator. The creators could have replaced the goat with a decent sized rock and I might have been more kind to it. Simply said, this is a gimmick. No, I do not recommend this. I would recommend making a sock puppet over playing this game, because it would be cheaper and more fulfilling.

It may look different, have different things, give different goats, but it is exactly the same! Run around, lick stuff, ragdoll.  Multiplayer is great too! If you can actually find someone who can play with you or someone dumb enough to buy the game. With two people you can do so much more! You can lick stuff, and ragdoll, and blow stuff up! Only this time, there's two people doing it.   Summary: Terrible game. Boring. Not much to do.
